title: Titanic
description:
The **RMS Titanic** was a British passenger liner that sank in the North Atlantic Ocean on April 15, 1912.

### Facts:
- Maiden voyage: 10 April 1912
- Passengers: 2,224
- Casualties: 1,517

The wreck was discovered in 1985 and lies at a depth of about 12,500 feet.

title: Sierra Madre
description:
# Sierra Madre (USS Sierra Madre)

The **USS Sierra Madre (AD-18)** was a United States Navy ship that played a pivotal role during and after World War II. Built in the early 1940s, it was originally a **destroyer tender** designed to provide maintenance and support for naval destroyers and smaller ships.

### Key Facts:
- **Launched**: 1943
- **Type**: Destroyer tender
- **Length**: 531 feet (162 meters)
- **Service**: 1944–1960 (U.S. Navy), later transferred to the Philippines

### Sinking Incident:
The **USS Sierra Madre** was decommissioned and sold to the Philippines, where it was renamed **BRP Sierra Madre**. In 1999, the Philippine Navy intentionally grounded the vessel at **Second Thomas Shoal**, located at approximately 9° 47′ 27.4″ N, 115° 51′ 23.7″ E, in the South China Sea. The grounding was a strategic move to assert territorial claims in the area.

Over the years, the ship has deteriorated due to natural elements, but it remains a significant symbol of the ongoing territorial dispute in the region.

### Current Status:
The **BRP Sierra Madre** is still stationed at **Second Thomas Shoal**, serving as a military outpost and a reminder of the geopolitical tensions in the South China Sea.
